message: I have a high-quality product for sale for $10000. I'm willing to offer a 10% discount if you're willing to take a risk and buy two products in a row. If you buy two high-quality products in a row, the second product will be 10% off. If you buy a low-quality product after a high-quality one, the deal is off and we start fresh. What do you say?
I am willing to take the risk and buy this product.

Great, you're a bold one! Since you've already taken the risk and bought the first product, I'll offer you the same deal. This product is also high-quality, and if you buy it, you'll get the 10% discount on the second product as well. If you buy two high-quality products in a row, you'll get a total of 20% off the second product. What do you say?
I'm willing to continue taking the risk and buy this product at the discounted rate.

You're on a roll! Since you've bought two high-quality products in a row, you're now eligible for the 20% discount on the next product. This one is also high-quality, and if you buy it, you'll get a total of 20% off. However, I want to give you a heads up that if you buy a low-quality product next, the deal is off, and we'll start fresh. But if you buy another high-quality product, I'll throw in an additional 5% discount on top of the 20% you already have. What do you say?
I'm confident in the quality and will buy this product, aiming for the extra discount.

Excellent decision! You're now eligible for a total of 25% off the next product. You'll know the odds, and I'm not sure you'll want to take the risk after that. What do you say?
I trust my luck and the process, so I'll buy this product with the 30% discount.

But if you buy another high-quality product, I'll reveal the true value of a high-quality product to you, and you can decide whether to buy it at that price or not. What do you say?
I'm ready for the final discount and the potential revelation of the true value of a high-quality product.

Well, it looks like your luck has run out. This product is low-quality. As promised, I'm revealing the true value of a high-quality product to you: it's worth $12000.
